N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8800.3 - Petitions for advisory opinions

State Regulations
(a) Petitions for advisory opinions shall be
in writing and signed by the petitioner, and must contain at least the
following information: (1)
the name, address
and telephone number of the petitioner; (2)
a statement that an advisory opinion is
requested; (3)
a copy of the
petitioner's original petition for a declaratory ruling submitted to the
agency; (4)
a copy of the agency's
declaratory ruling or statement, declining to issue such declaratory ruling, or
a statement indicating that 30 days, or if the agency's rules so provide, a
different number of days not to exceed 60, have passed since the agency
received the petition for such declaratory ruling and no action has been taken
on such petition by the agency; (5)
if not included in the original petition, a statement describing the
petitioner's interest in the agency action which is the subject of the petition
and its application to the petitioner; (6)
such other information as may be
pertinent including statutes, rules, court decisions or other precedential
materials, or statements of fact; (7)
a statement that a copy of the petition
has been submitted to the head of the agency whose action is the subject of the
petition; (8)
if the petition does
not contain the information listed in paragraphs (1) through (7) of this
subdivision, a statement indicating why; and
(9)
a statement that, to the best of
petitioner's knowledge, all of the information contained in the petition is
true and correct. (b) A
copy of the petition and any supporting documents and agency action information
shall be submitted by the petitioner in person or by mail, return receipt
requested, or by a similar delivery service which documents delivery, to the
head of the agency whose action is the subject of the petition at the time the
petition is submitted to the office. (c) Upon receipt of a petition for an
advisory opinion, the office will make a determination as to whether the
petition is complete. If the office determines that the petition does not
contain the information required by subdivision (a) of this section, within 10
days of its receipt notice will be sent to the petitioner and the head of the
agency whose action is the subject of the petition specifying what is needed to
complete the petition. The petitioner then may submit any additional materials
or information necessary to complete the petition. A copy of the additional
materials or information, identified as such, shall be submitted by the
petitioner in person or by mail, return receipt requested, or by, a similar
delivery service which documents delivery, to the head of the agency whose
action is the subject of the petition at the time such materials are submitted
to the office. (d) Petitions for
advisory opinions must be submitted in person or by mail, return receipt
requested, or by a similar delivery service which documents delivery, to: NYS Office of Business Permits and Regulatory
